p: Twenty three components have been identified in H. gymnocephalum essential oil by GC-MS ( Figure 1 and Table 1). Sesquiterpene hydrocarbons and oxygenated monoterpenes were the major groups of compounds (32.4% and 54.0%, respectively), while oxygenated sesquiterpenes were not present. The major monoterpenes found were 1,8-cineole (47.4%), p-cymene (4.3%), ( E)-β-ocimene (2.4%), 2,3-dihydro-1,8-cineole (2.1%) and α-terpinolene (1,3%). Among the sesquiterpene hydrocarbons bicyclosesquiphellandrene (5.6%), γ-curcumene (5.6%), α-amorphene (5.1%) and bicyclogermacrene (5%) were present in appreciable quantities. On the other hand, this essential oil contained a phenolic compound (2,3-di- tert-butylphenol) at 0.5%.
